thought: Since the website is accessible, I will now extract the text to look for any signs that indicate it might be a scam, such as unusually low prices, unrealistic money claims, psychological targeting, or outdated information.
observation: NJIC: Receivables Collection Services - NJIC  Hit enter to search or ESC to close CASE STUDIES Technology Health Care International Business Services Manufacturers FAQ FEES Contact Us Free Evaluation Place Accounts LOGIN Accounts Receivable Management with Legal Support — $100M+ recovered — Case Studies NATIONAL JUDGMENT INVESTMENT CORP. (NJIC) recovers commercial accounts receivable and locates assets of judgment debtors to satisfy monetary judgments for clients ranging from small businesses to Fortune 500 companies. Contingency fee collection, taking a percentage of what we recover, with no upfront fees. Seamless integration with your accounts receivable department, including real-time tracking of our collection progress with your files. Attorney-driven collections process with litigation as an option. Worldwide legal network to track down debtors. NJIC’s 75%+ recovery rate is nearly triple industry norms: NJIC’s success comes from its relentless pursuit of debtors coupled with the potential threat of litigation. NJIC founder, Nathan Neuman, has over two decades of experience protecting the rights of creditors. Seamless Integration As attorneys and paralegals, NJIC uses a professional approach towards collection which allows you to preserve your customer relationships. If necessary, we can handle your past due accounts from collection to judgment and post-judgment execution. Outsourcing overdue accounts receivable results in less administrative time and costs on your part and more effective streamlined results. View our case studies and see actual records showing consistent recoveries. We serve a wide range of industries, including manufacturing Legal claims are perishable, and the probability of recovery diminishes with time. It’s advisable to get legal help as quickly as possible. Get Started To begin, complete our After receipt of your claims, NJIC begins the process of verifying the business status of your delinquent customers, determining recoverability, and the appropriate collection strategy. NJIC will make contact with your customer in pursuit of the monies which are due and owing to your company. Industry Analysis Our 25+ years of experience gives us industry expertise. View our industry analysis, case studies, references, and actual results. Proprietary Tracking System AccountTrak tm Monitor NJIC’s collection progress of your accounts receivable with AccountTrak. Begin the process of placing accounts with us for recovery through our Claims Request Form “We have been using the collection services of National Judgment Investment Corp. for the last decade. While our in-house team is adept at collections, there comes a time where files need to be turned over to third-party professionals. Currently, NJIC is the only debt collection service we are using because of its expertise in quickly and professionally recovering our accounts receivable. We have been extremely satisfied with both NJIC’s success rate and service. More importantly, NJIC’s collection rate of dollars placed versus dollars recovered is in excess of 80%. This bottom line pleases both our Board of Directors and shareholders.” Steven H., Credit Services Manager Medical Device Manufacturer, NYSE listed based in Minnesota. “Ever since the first account I placed with NJIC, I have found their collection processes, professional team and accountability second to none. There have been several accounts which I had personally considered to be uncollectible and reserved for, yet NJIC was able to recover those delinquent accounts! Over the years I have placed many high five-figure accounts with NJIC for collection not just because of their successful rate of recovery, but because I trust them – I believe that is the most valuable quality when placing a company’s cash flow and name on the line with a third-party collector.” Emily L., President Publishing Company, NJ “We are very satisfied with National Judgment’s debt recovery services especially during the past year of COVID. The ability to collect unpaid invoices from businesses damaged by the pandemic requires a skillful touch in getting our company’s invoices elevated to the top of the line to be paid while other creditors are knocking on the door for payment. We believe that NJIC’s attorney driven approach gets us to the front of the payment line quickly when fighting for limited dollars available to pay ever increasing creditors. I highly recommend NJIC’s services for any company experiencing non-paying customers.” John C., Chief Financial Officer Software Company, NASDAQ listed San Francisco, CA “Since January 2015 we have discontinued using all other debt recovery agencies that we previously dealt with and are exclusively using National Judgment Investment Corporation exclusively. We have been nothing less than amazed at their ability to pursue and successfully recover our accounts receivable, many of which date back over two to three years. In fact, many of the accounts recovered by National Judgment Investment Corporation were accounts that had been previously placed with another agency who had been unsuccessful in recovering any monies due our company.” Manufacturer, Fortune 500 Company Evansville, IN “The collection firm of NJIC has performed exceptionally with the accounts we have placed with it for recovery.  At least one of NJIC’s recoveries was from a company which was out of business! NJIC’s in-house legal team crafted an argument which paved the way for NJIC to make the recovery from the acquirer of the debtor company. While we have used collection firms in the past, NJIC was the first and only firm we have used which combines legal power with collection talent on a contingency fee basis. Their collection rate with our files is in excess of 80%. We highly recommend NJIC for B2B collections.” Jasper M., Collection & Credit Manager Technology Company, Boca Raton, FL Previous Next Contact NJIC National Judgment Investment Corp. Home Fees © 2024 NJIC.

thought: The text extracted from the website does not show any obvious signs of a scam, such as unusually low prices or claims of free services. The company claims to have a high recovery rate for debts and works with businesses on a contingency fee basis. However, the website claims a recovery rate that is "nearly triple industry norms," which could be considered a red flag. Before making a conclusion, I need to verify the legitimacy of the company and if the information provided is truthful and consistent.

thought: The certificate information shows that the website is secured with a certificate from Let's Encrypt, which is common and expected. The common name '5c32ef1b2c.nxcli.net' does not seem to match the domain 'njicorp.com', which could be a red flag, but this could also be a technical setup of the hosting provider. The certificates are current, with the most recent one issued on April 3, 2024, and valid until July 2, 2024. This does not reveal any immediate signs of a scam, but it is worth noting the common name discrepancy. I should now check the DNS records to see if there is anything unusual about the website's setup.

The DNS records show that the domain has a typical configuration with MX records for mail, A record pointing to an IP address, and NS records indicating it is hosted with Nexcess, a known hosting provider. There's nothing inherently suspicious here. However, the SPF record includes a directive to allow mail from the IP address and mail channels, which is normal for a business to set up to prevent email spoofing. Overall, nothing stands out as a red flag from the DNS records. At this point, I have checked the website's accessibility, extracted text, checked for hyperlinks, reviewed WHOIS data, reviewed certificate information, and DNS records. There is no evidence from social media through Twitter or Reddit, and while there are a few potential concerns, such as the claim of a high debt recovery rate and a lack of social presence, these alone are not definitive indicators of a scam. The website seems to be a legitimate business offering B2B debt collection services. However, without external confirmation or complaints about the company, I cannot definitively state that it is a scam. I now know the final answer. The URL https://njicorp.com/ does not show enough definitive evidence of being a scam website based on the information and analysis performed.

observation.reason: The website's content and setup do not show definitive evidence of common scam characteristics. Claims of high debt recovery rates and lack of social media presence are not conclusive indicators of a scam.
